definition: It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
lone/lonely
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)

sentences.english: A peaceful future is possible only with two states, not just the one.
sentences.chinese: 但是孤掌难鸣，只有巴以双方共同努力才能实现和平。

sentences.english: Zilong was helpless. With Ah Dou in his arms, how could he shift the boat toward shore?
sentences.chinese: 赵云孤掌难鸣，只护得阿斗，安能移舟傍岸。

definition: isolated and without help
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
powerless to defend oneself (idiom); helpless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
not good/of no use
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
